Package gameobjects

Class Ball

  • java.lang.Object
    • danogl.GameObject
      • gameobjects.Ball
  • public class Ball
extends danogl.GameObject
    Represents a ball in the game, responsible for handling ball-specific behaviors such as collisions. This class extends GameObject and is a central element in gameplay, interacting with other game objects.
    Version:
    Java 11
    Author:
    Noam Shabat

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ball

        public Ball​(danogl.util.Vector2 topLeftCorner,
            danogl.util.Vector2 dimensions,
            danogl.gui.rendering.Renderable renderable,
            danogl.gui.Sound collisionSound)
        Constructs a new Ball object.
        Parameters:
        topLeftCorner - The top-left corner of the ball in the game window.
        dimensions - The dimensions (width and height) of the ball.
        renderable - The graphical representation of the ball.
        collisionSound - The sound to play on collision.

    • Method Detail

      • getTag

        public java.lang.String getTag()
        Returns a unique tag for this game object.
        Overrides:
        getTag in class danogl.GameObject
        Returns:
        A string representing the tag of this object.

      • getCollisionCounter

        public int getCollisionCounter()
        Retrieves the count of collisions that have occurred across all Ball instances.
        Returns:
        The total number of collisions.

      • onCollisionEnter

        public void onCollisionEnter​(danogl.GameObject other,
                             danogl.collisions.Collision collision)
        Called when this ball collides with another game object. Updates the ball's velocity based on the collision, plays a collision sound, and increments the collision counter.
        Overrides:
        onCollisionEnter in class danogl.GameObject
        Parameters:
        other - The other game object involved in the collision.
        collision - Information about the collision.
